document.docAuthor: Gravili, Cinzia, Vito, Doris De, Camillo, Cristina Gioia Di, Martell, Luis, Piraino, Stefano & Boero, Ferdinando
document.masterDocTitle: The non-Siphonophoran Hydrozoa (Cnidaria) of Salento, Italy with notes on their life-cycles: an illustrated guide

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The non-Siphonophoran Hydrozoa (Cnidaria) of Salento, Italy with notes on their life-cycles: an illustrated guide

subSubSection.paragraph:
See
Peña Cantero & García Carrascosa ( 2002 )
for a complete synonymy.
Material examined. HCUS-S 0 73 (Hydrozoa Collection, University of Salento—fauna of the Salento Peninsula).

Hydroid. Hydrorhiza as creeping stolon system; colonies erect, delicate; hydrocauli monosiphonic, perisarc of internodes thin and annulated throughout, apical stolons frequent; hydrocladia originating laterally, below hydrothecae, curved at base; hydrothecae at end of each internode, shallow, walls straight at basal half and curved outward at distal half, with a ring of desmocytes above diaphragm, secondary hydrothecae present, arising directly from primaries. Gonothecae: female gonothecae ringed throughout, with a lateral aperture with 2 hydranths, male gonothecae oval, elongated and with transverse undulations.

Habitat type .
Littoral species, ranging from the tidal level down to 40 m depth (
Rossi 1961
; García
Carrascosa 1981
;
Boero & Fresi 1986
).

Substrate. Epibiotic on a wide range of organisms, such as algae,
Posidonia
,
Cymodocea nodosa
,
Zostera
leaves, other hydroids, bryozoans, cirripedes, mussels, Anthozoa.

Reproductive period. February (
Stechow 1919
; Coma et al. 1992 ); March (Gili 1986 ; Coma et al. 1992 ); April (
Boero & Fresi 1986
; Coma et al. 1992 ); September (
Faucci & Boero 2000
); October (
Boero & Fresi 1986
); February–April (Llobet i Nidal 1987 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 66.
Halecium pusillum
: A , hydroid with planktonic propagules; B , hydroid with female gonotheca; C , hydroid with male gonotheca (A, B, C same scale bar) (drawn by F. Boero). Scale bar: 1.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks.
Halecium pusillum
also forms vegetative shoots (frustules) for asexual reproduction (
Huvé 1955
) that have been observed also by
Boero and Fresi ( 1986 )
,
Ramil ( 1988 )
, and Coma et al. ( 1992 ). In Otranto, colonies have been found with symbiotic zooxanthellae (De Vito 2006 ; this study).

References.
Motz-Kossowska ( 1911 )
,
Broch ( 1912
, 1933 ),
Babic ( 1913 a)
,
Stechow ( 1919 )
also as
Halecium annulatum
;
Leloup ( 1934 )
,
Picard & Le Roch ( 1949 )
,
Picard ( 1952
, 1958a ),
Rossi ( 1961 )
,
Repetto et al. ( 1977 )
, García
Carrascosa ( 1981 )
, Morri ( 1985 ),
Morri & Bianchi ( 1985 )
,
Boero & Fresi ( 1986 )
, Gili ( 1986 ),
Llobet et al. ( 1986
, 1991 ), García
Rubies ( 1987 )
, Llobet i Nidal ( 1987 ),
Piraino & Morri ( 1990 )
,
Morri et al. ( 1991 )
, Coma et al. ( 1992 ), Altuna ( 1994 ),
Medel & López-González ( 1996 )
, Medel et al. ( 1998 ), Morri & Bianchi ( 1999 ),
Piraino et al. ( 1999 )
,
Faucci & Boero ( 2000 )
,
Miglietta et al. ( 2000 )
,
Fraschetti et al. ( 2002 )
,
Peña Cantero & García Carrascosa ( 2002 )
, Bouillon et al. ( 2004 ), De Vito ( 2006 ), Gravili ( 2006 ), Denitto et al. ( 2007 ),
Gravili et al . ( 2008 a)
,
Morri et al. ( 2009 )
, Puce et al . ( 2009 ),
Ventura ( 2011 )
,
Piraino et al. ( 2013 )
.
